Andrew Bartlett wrote:

>>> I don't see the harm in having these sorts of options in 
>>> the code, but deliberately not documenting them.
>> But they never stay undocumented.  They become part of Samba
>> urban legends.
> 
> Has that actually happened?  I don't know of any 
> Samba legends about 'auth methods', which has been an
> a similar situation for a long time...

yes.  periodically, an smb.conf gets posted with
a non-default "auth methods" value.  I can dig up posts if
you like.  And then there was the debian config files that
shipped with "passdb backend" including "guest" in the
list of values.
